content: वृध् {vI.v} {c1c} <ab>A.</ab> (but Paras, also in the Second Future, Aorist and Conditional, also in the Desiderative) (वर्धते, ववृधे, अवृधत्-अवर्धिष्ट, वर्धिऽयते वर्स्त्यति, वृद्ध; {%<ab>desid.</ab>%} विवृत्सति, or विवर्धिषते) {@--1@} To grow, increase, become larger, stronger, or greater, thrive, prosper; अन्योन्यजयसंरंभो ववृधे वादिनोरिव <ls>R. 12. 92</ls>, <ls n="R.">10. 78</ls>; धनक्षये वर्धति जाठराग्निः <ls>Subhāṣ.</ls>; <ls>Bk. 14. 13</ls>, <ls n="Bk.">19. 26.</ls> {@--2@} To continue, last. {@--3@} To rise, ascend. {@--4@} To have cause for congratulation, usually with दिष्ट्या; दिष्ट्या धर्मपत्नीसमागमेन पुत्रमुखदर्शनेन चायुष्मान् वर्धते <ls>Ś. 7</ls> ‘your honour is to be congratulated upon your union’ &c. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} (वर्धयति-ते, also वर्धापयति-ते) {@--1@} To cause to grow, increase, augment, heighten, amplify, enhance; वर्धयन्निव तत्कूटानुद्धूतैर्धातुरेणुभिः <ls>R. 4. 71.</ls> {@--2@} To cause to prosper or thrive, glorify, magnify, exalt; <ls>H. 3. 3.</ls> {@--3@} To congratulate, felicitate (वर्धापयाति in this sense); यदि कोपि त्वां सांप्रतं मदयंतिकालाभेन वर्धापयति तदा किं तस्य पारितोषिकं करोषि <ls>Māl. 8.</ls> {vII.v} {c10c} <ab>U.</ab> (वर्धयति-ते) {@--1@} To speak. {@--2@} To shine.
